text: so my paper (published in mid 2020) just got its first citation, but it’s from a paper published in 2018. How does that work? They clearly never cited me. This is on google scholars

text: I'm definitely too lazy to see if a working paper has been published, at least in economics, when adding the citation for our own working papers. But in the copy-editing stage of final publication that should get sorted out

text: I think it's a fluke. Reading that paper they don't mention your work at all. Not in the supplementary parts either.

text: Yeah I don't know what's up with Google Scholar lately.. According to Google Scholar,  this paper <https://arxiv.org/pdf/2010.00684.pdf> cites 2 of my papers. [It definitely does not, nor is it related in any way..]
